comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: This photo looks dodgy.   Was the gap between Garden Island and Potts Point really that big ?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
The six-masted ship is the American Helen B Sterling.   It was in Sydney Harbour for a couple of years after it became unseaworthy,  and was eventually scrapped at Kerosene Bay.

It was attempted in 1930 to use the ship as some sort of cabaret venue,  and in December 1930,  a few days before this photo,  there was a notable orgy there.

In 1931 it went under the Harbour Bridge at low tide with 5 feet clearance,  notable enough apparently to be reported in the paper.

There were relatively few six-masted ships ever built.
